00016 =head1 NAME

00018 WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::ProblemRenderer - renderViaXMLRPC is an HTML

00026 package WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::instructorXMLHandler;
00027 use base qw(WeBWorK::ContentGenerator);

00041 
00042 =head1 Description
00043 
00044 
00045 #################################################
00046   instructorXMLHandler -- a front end for the Webservice that accepts HTML forms
00047 
00048   receives WeBWorK problems presented as HTML forms, usually created with js xmlhttprequests,
00049   packages the form variables into an XML_RPC request
00050  suitable for all of the webservices in WebworkWebservices
00051  returns xml resutls
00052 #################################################
00053 
00054 =cut
00055  
00056 # To configure the target webwork server two URLs are required
00057 # 1. $XML_URL   http://test.webwork.maa.org/mod_xmlrpc
00058 #    points to the Webservice.pm and Webservice/RenderProblem modules
00059 #    Is used by the client to send the original XML request to the webservice
00060 #
00061 # 2. $FORM_ACTION_URL      http:http://test.webwork.maa.org/webwork2/html2xml
00062 #    points to the renderViaXMLRPC.pm module.
00063 #
00064 #     This url is placed as form action url when the rendered HTML from the original
00065 #     request is returned to the client from Webservice/RenderProblem. The client
00066 #     reorganizes the XML it receives into an HTML page (with a WeBWorK form) and 
00067 #     pipes it through a local browser.
00068 #
00069 #     The browser uses this url to resubmit the problem (with answers) via the standard
00070 #     HTML webform used by WeBWorK to the renderViaXMLRPC.pm handler.  
00071 #
00072 #     This renderViaXMLRPC.pm handler acts as an intermediary between the browser 
00073 #     and the webservice.  It interprets the HTML form sent by the browser, 
00074 #     rewrites the form data in XML format, submits it to the WebworkWebservice.pm 
00075 #     which processes it and sends the the resulting HTML back to renderViaXMLRPC.pm
00076 #     which in turn passes it back to the browser.
00077 # 3.  The second time a problem is submitted renderViaXMLRPC.pm receives the WeBWorK form 
00078 #     submitted directly by the browser.  
00079 #     The renderViaXMLRPC.pm translates the WeBWorK form, has it processes by the webservice
00080 #     and returns the result to the browser. 
00081 #     The The client renderProblem.pl script is no longer involved.
00082 # 4.  Summary: renderProblem.pl is only involved in the first round trip
00083 #     of the submitted problem.  After that the communication is  between the browser and
00084 #     renderViaXMLRPC using HTML forms and between renderViaXMLRPC and the WebworkWebservice.pm
00085 #     module using XML_RPC.
00086 
00087 
00088 # Determine the root directory for webwork on this machine (e.g. /opt/webwork/webwork2 )
00089 # this is set in webwork.apache2-config
00090 # it specifies the address of the webwork root directory
00091 
00092 #my $webwork_dir  = $ENV{WEBWORK_ROOT};
00093 my $webwork_dir  = $WeBWorK::Constants::WEBWORK_DIRECTORY;
00094 unless ($webwork_dir) {
00095     die "renderViaXMLRPC.pm requires that the top WeBWorK directory be set in ".
00096     "\$WeBWorK::Constants::WEBWORK_DIRECTORY by webwork.apache-config or webwork.apache2-config\n";
00097 }
00098 
00099 # read the webwork2/conf/global.conf file to determine other parameters
00100 #
00101 my $seed_ce = new WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment({ webwork_dir => $webwork_dir });
00102 my $server_root_url = $seed_ce->{server_root_url};
00103 unless ($server_root_url) {
00104     die "unable to determine apache server url using course environment |$seed_ce|.".
00105         "check that the variable \$server_root_url has been properly set in conf/global.conf\n";
00106 }

00131 # error formatting
00132 sub format_hash_ref {
00133     my $hash = shift;
00134     warn "Use a hash reference".caller() unless ref($hash) =~/HASH/;
00135     my $out_str="";
00136     my $count =4;
00137     foreach my $key ( sort keys %$hash) {
00138         my $value = defined($hash->{$key})? $hash->{$key}:"--";
00139         $out_str.= " $key=>$value ";
00140         $count--;
00141         unless($count) { $out_str.="\n  ";$count =4;}
00142     }
00143     $out_str;
00144 }

00154 sub pre_header_initialize {
00155     my ($self) = @_;
00156     my $r = $self->r;
00157  
00158     
00159  
00160

00162     #######################
00163     #  setup xmlrpc client
00164     #######################
00165     my $xmlrpc_client = new WebworkClient;
00166 
00167     $xmlrpc_client->url($XML_URL);
00168     $xmlrpc_client->{form_action_url}= $FORM_ACTION_URL;
00169     $xmlrpc_client->{displayMode}   = DISPLAYMODE();

00172     $xmlrpc_client->{course}        = $r->param('courseID');
00173     # print STDERR WebworkClient::pretty_print($r->{paramcache});

00180     #   command      =>  'all',
00181     #};

00202              library_textsection    =>  $r->param("library_textsection") ||undef,
00203              source          =>   '',
00204     };
00205     if ($UNIT_TESTS_ON) {
00206         print STDERR "instructorXMLHandler.pm ".__LINE__." values obtained from form parameters\n\t",
00207            format_hash_ref($input);
00208     }
00209     my $source = "";
00210     #print $r->param('problemSource');
00211     my $problem = $r->param('problemSource');
00212     if (defined($problem) and $problem and -r $problem ) {
00213         $source = `cat $problem`;
00214         #print "SOURCE\n".$source;
00215         $input->{source} = encode_base64($source);
00216     }
00217     
00218     my $std_input = standard_input();
00219     $input = {%$std_input, %$input};
00220     
00221     ##########################################
00222     # FIXME hack to get fileName or filePath   param("set") contains the path
00223     my $problemPath = $input->{set};   # FIXME should rename this ????
00224     $problemPath =~ m|templates/(.*)|;
00225     $problemPath = $1;    # get everything in the path after templates
00226     $input->{envir}->{fileName}= $problemPath;
00227     ##################################################
00228     $input->{courseID} = $r->param('courseID');
00229 
00230     ##############################
00231     # xmlrpc_client calls webservice with the requested command
00232     #
00233     # and stores the resulting XML output in $self->{output}
00234     # from which it will eventually be returned to the browser
00235     #
00236     ##############################
00237     #if ( $xmlrpc_client->jsXmlrpcCall($r->param("xml_command"), $input) ) {
00238     #   print "tried to render a problem";
00239         #$self->{output} = $xmlrpc_client->formatRenderedProblem;#not sure what to do here just yet.
00240     #} else {
00241     #   $self->{output} = $xmlrpc_client->{output};  # error report
00242     #   print $xmlrpc_client->{output};
00243     #}
00244     if($r->param('xml_command') eq "addProblem" || $r->param('xml_command') eq "deleteProblem"){
00245         $input->{path} = $r->param('problemPath');
00246     }
00247     
00248     if($r->param('xml_command') eq "renderProblem"){
00249         if (my $problemPath = $r->param('problemPath')) {
00250             $problemPath =~ m|templates/(.*)|;
00251             $problemPath = $1;    # get everything in the path after templates
00252             $input->{envir}->{fileName}=$problemPath;
00253         }
00254         $self->{output}->{problem_out} = $xmlrpc_client->xmlrpcCall('renderProblem', $input);
00255         
00256         #$self->{output}->{text} = "Rendered problem";
00257     } else {    
00258         $self->{output} = $xmlrpc_client->xmlrpcCall($r->param("xml_command"), $input);
00259     }
00260     ################################
00261  }

00389 sub pretty_print_json { 
00390     shift if UNIVERSAL::isa($_[0] => __PACKAGE__);
00391     my $rh = shift;
00392     my $indent = shift || 0;
00393     my $out = "";
00394     my $type = ref($rh);
00395 
00396     if (defined($type) and $type) {
00397         #$out .= " type = $type; ";
00398     } elsif (! defined($rh )) {
00399         #$out .= " type = UNDEFINED; ";
00400     }
00401     return $out."" unless defined($rh);
00402     
00403     if ( ref($rh) =~/HASH/ or "$rh" =~/HASH/ ) {
00404         $indent++;
00405         foreach my $key (sort keys %{$rh})  {
00406             $out .= "  ".'"'.$key.'" : '. pretty_print_json( $rh->{$key}) . ",";
00407         }
00408         $indent--;
00409         #get rid of the last comma
00410         chop $out;
00411         $out = "{\n$out\n"."}\n";
00412 
00413     } elsif (ref($rh)  =~  /ARRAY/ or "$rh" =~/ARRAY/) {
00414         foreach my $elem ( @{$rh} )  {
00415             $out .= pretty_print_json($elem).",";
00416         
00417         }
00418         #get rid of the last comma
00419         chop $out;
00420         $out =  '"'.$out.'"';
00421     } elsif ( ref($rh) =~ /SCALAR/ ) {
00422         $out .= "scalar reference ". ${$rh};
00423     } elsif ( ref($rh) =~/Base64/ ) {
00424         $out .= "base64 reference " .$$rh;
00425     } else {
00426         $out .=  $rh;
00427     }
00428     
00429     return $out."";
00430 }
00431 
00432 sub content {
00433    ###########################
00434    # Return content of rendered problem to the browser that requested it
00435    ###########################
00436     my $self = shift;
00437     #for handling errors...i'm to lazy to make it work right now
00438     if($self->{output}->{problem_out}){
00439         print $self->{output}->{problem_out}->{text};
00440     } else {
00441         print '{"server_response":"'.$self->{output}->{text}.'",';
00442         if($self->{output}->{ra_out}){
00443             print '"result_data":'.pretty_print_json($self->{output}->{ra_out}).'}';
00444         } else {
00445             print '"result_data":""}';
00446         }
00447     }
00448     #print "".pretty_print_json($self->{output}->{ra_out});
00449 }
